content.source_2: Brown's Requiem (novel) Brown's Requiem is a 1981 crime novel, the first novel by American author James Ellroy. Ellroy dedicated "Brown's Requiem", "to Randy Rice". German-American Los Angeles-based detective Fritz Brown is hired by the mysterious caddie Fat Dog Baker, who wants him to spy on his sister Jane and her benefactor, the much older businessman Sol Kupferman. Brown recognizes Kupferman as a man he had seen at the Club Utopia before it was burned down some years before.
